featured.text: The booth he built 25 only an old dial phone with a disconnected phone line.
News about the phone gradually spread, and the booth has become a 28 between the living and the dead.
Feeling that he needed a private space to help him navigate through the 24 , Sasaki positioned a booth where he could “speak” to the dead relative.
When he stepped into the booth, he could pick up the phone to call his cousin, telling him how he was, and how he missed him.
The concept was 11 by Richard Booth, who opened the first second-hand bookshop in Hay-on-Wye, UK in 1961.

definition.zh_def: 一個小型的封閉空間，通常用於展示、銷售或提供服務。
definition.en_def: A small enclosed space, often used for displaying, selling, or providing services.
definition.example: She set up a booth at the fair to sell handmade jewelry.
